com.netflix.msl.msg
Class MslControl.RespondService

java.lang.Object
  com.netflix.msl.msg.MslControl.RespondService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Callable<MslControl.MslChannel>
Enclosing class:
MslControl
private class MslControl.RespondService
extends Object
implements Callable<MslControl.MslChannel>

This service sends a response to the remote entity.

This class will only be used trusted network servers and peer-to-peer servers.

MslControl.RespondService

public MslControl.RespondService(MslContext ctx,
                                 MessageContext msgCtx,
                                 InputStream in,
                                 OutputStream out,
                                 MessageInputStream request,
                                 int timeout)
Create a new message respond service.

Parameters:
ctx - MSL context.
msgCtx - message context.
in - remote entity input stream.
out - remote entity output stream.
request - request message input stream.
timeout - renewal lock acquisition timeout in milliseconds.
Method Detail

trustedNetworkExecute

private MslControl.MslChannel trustedNetworkExecute(MessageBuilder builder,
                                                    int msgCount)
                                             throws MslException,
                                                    MslErrorResponseException,
                                                    IOException,
                                                    InterruptedException
Send the response as a trusted network server.

Parameters:
builder - response message builder.
msgCount - number of messages that have already been sent or received.
Returns:
the MSL channel if the response was sent or null if cancelled, interrupted, if the response could not be sent encrypted or integrity protected when required, a user could not be attached due to lack of a master token, or if the maximum message count is hit.
Throws:
MslException - if there was an error creating the response.
MslErrorResponseException - if there was an error sending an automatically generated error response.
IOException - if there was an error writing the message.
InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while trying to delete an old master token the sent message is replacing.

peerToPeerExecute

private MslControl.MslChannel peerToPeerExecute(MessageContext msgCtx,
                                                MessageBuilder builder,
                                                int msgCount)
                                         throws MslException,
                                                IOException,
                                                InterruptedException,
                                                MslErrorResponseException
Send the response as a peer-to-peer entity.

Parameters:
msgCtx - message context.
builder - response message builder.
msgCount - number of messages sent or received so far.
Returns:
a MSL channel if the response was sent or false if cancelled, interrupted, or if the response could not be sent encrypted or integrity protected when required, a user could not be attached due to lack of a master token, or if the maximum message count is hit.
Throws:
MslException - if there was an error creating the response.
MslErrorResponseException - if there was an error sending an automatically generated error response.
IOException - if there was an error writing the message.
InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while trying to acquire the master token lock.

call

public MslControl.MslChannel call()
                           throws MslException,
                                  MslErrorResponseException,
                                  IOException
Specified by:
call in interface Callable<MslControl.MslChannel>
Returns:
a MslControl.MslChannel on success or null if cancelled, interrupted, if an error response was received (peer-to-peer mode only), if the response could not be sent encrypted or integrity protected when required (trusted network-mode only), or if the maximum number of messages is hit.
Throws:
MslException - if there was an error creating the response.
MslErrorResponseException - if there was an error sending an automatically generated error response.
IOException - if there was an error writing the message.
See Also:
Callable.call()
